description: From Middle English acqueren, from Old French aquerre, from Latin acquirō; ad- + quaerō (“to seek for”). See quest.

verbs.description: acquire (third-person singular simple present acquires, present participle acquiring, simple past and past participle acquired)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To gain, usually by one's own exertions; to get as one's own
examples: all the riches he acquired were from hard work.
One should acquire as much knowledge as possible from reading.
to acquire decent habits and manners

entries.meaning: (computing) To sample signals and convert them into digital values.
